ygData.subject: Mummies at 9
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually if you have a pet mummies are great at level 9 just make sure you get expluse undead. After that you should make short work of undead. ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
Actually if you have a pet mummies are great at level 9 just make sure you
get expluse undead. After that you should make short work of undead.
-----Original Message-----
From: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 8:31 AM

>Message: 1
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 14:57:18 -0400
> From: "Jaded" <jaded@...>
>Subject: Re: Just a tought
>
>Huh? I haven't seen much "that class is better than ours" griping on this
>list, at all.
>
>I just started a DE Necro. My humie necro was only level 5, and I figured
>I'd back off of him and go the full-bore necromancer/evil guy way of life.
>Plus the human had an INT of 105. This guy's got 130 INT.
>
>
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Liet [mailto:arrakis@...]
>Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 1:55 PM
>To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Just a tought
>
>
>I 've been on many mailing lists for a while and all I hear is people
>complaining about the other classes being better...
>the mages complained about the necro the necro about the mages and so on.
>If verant says the classes are balanced I trust em (except for the rogues
>wich still dont have poisoning)
>Of course the neighbor's grass is always more green.
>So if you dont like the class just check out another but please stop
pissing
>me off with worthless "he got this and that, Im jealous".
>Necro is a hard class to play if you are not good with tactics , you might
>try a bard or something
>
>Ghast Shin'Ra - Tunare
>
>
>
>

>Message: 2
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 15:10:38 -0400
> From: Vadim Glik <zvadim@...>
>Subject: Re: DElf Necro (9th) Needs hunting / exp / cash tips
>
>I'm a 10lvl DE, and I went from 8-10 mostly in northern RO. The tunnel to
it is
>located on the opposite side of commons from entrance to Nectulos forest.
>I hunt scarabs and desert tarantulas at northern RO. Scarabs are best,
since they do
>not poison, their carapace is worth a gold or so, you can take yellow ones
fairly easy:
>lifetap, cast DOTs, keep your pet alive and get some hits in. Watch out
for madman and
>people training mummies. Mummies can be difficult at 8-9. Melissa
Sandwhisper an NPC
>merchant close to zone border with freeport is tolerant enough to sell to
me, she
>carries water and rations.
>
>
>
>Renaissance Man wrote:
>
>> From: "Renaissance Man" <cossettb@...>
>>
>> I'm frustrated. I've got a level 9 Necro DElf, based in Nekk Forest. I've
>> got 2 problems: a lack of cash and difficulty in gaining exp.
>>
>> I've been in in Nekk Forest, and I prefer to solo for the most part. The
>> problem is finding targets to hunt. In Nekk forest, the only mobs that
give
>> me experience are Kodiaks and some skeletons. Mummies and zombies too,
but
>> those are even more rare, plus there's usually 3-4 other PC's camped at
the
>> spawn sites. The Lava zone seems to be too high-level for me (from
reports
>> from others), and while Eastern commons isn't too bad the Griffins are
>> murder and getting poisoned by an asp has killed me twice. Last time I
went
>> through the commons I died enough that I lost all the exp. gained.
>>
>> On top of this is cash flow problems. Since the rank 3 spells each cost
4.5
>> pp, it's bloody expensive getting them. I picked up tailoring as a trade
to
>> hopefully help get extra money, but my skill is maxed at 30 from
patchwork
>> armor, and I don't know that I want to take up smithing to increase it
some
>> more (by making studded and re-inforced etc.). I've considered maybe
taking
>> up another trade to help with getting extra money. Any suggestions?
>>
>> Desperately waiting to hit 12th level and get some decent offensive
spells .
>> . .
>>
>> Brad Cossette - cossettb@...
>> Sabbaoth (Dark Elf Necro 9) - Bertoxxulous
>> "My advice to you is to get married. If you find a good wife,
>> you'll be happy; if not, you'll become a philosopher." - Socrates
>>
>> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> ONElist members are using Shared Files in great ways!
>> http://www.onelist.com
>> Are you? If not, see our homepage for details.
>> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> This list is basically unmoderated. However abusive language will not be
tolerated
>
>

>Subject: PET COMMANDS
>

>Message: 5
> Date: Thu, 13 May 1999 11:45:38 -0400
> From: "Mata" <mata_eq@...>
>Subject: Re: VAMPIRIC EMBRACE
>
>Sweet! So the spell has a duration and you cast it and them melee??? and
it
>can happen more than once?? That is great!
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: <TkAdam@...>
>To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
>Sent: Thursday, May 13, 1999 11:26 AM
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] VAMPIRIC EMBRACE
>
>
>> From: TkAdam@...
>>
>> In a message dated 5/13/99 10:57:03 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
>> mata_eq@... writes:
>>
>> > it says this spell is a touch deliver spell so do I have to UNARMED
>attack?
>> > or can I melee w/ dagger and just cast it???
>> >
>> > If I need to unarmed attack to deliver this spell should I start
>fighting
>> > unarmed to get that skill up??? Can ANYONE tell me how this spell
>works,
>>
>> ANY melee (hand to hand, piercing, two handed blunt, or one handed blunt)
>> attack is useful for that spell. It will RANDOMLY flare and do about 28
>> points of lifetap. (it will not go off every time you hit... just
>randomly)
>>
>> > and why a Necromancer needs a HIGH DEX . . .
>> >
>> > does the high Dex help to hit in hand to hand combat???
>> >
>> It is RUMORED (no confirmation) to help with being interupted in
>spellcasting.
>>
>> why specifically they made it a prime for Necros is unknown to me.
>> > thanks. . .
>> >
>>
>> Sonoroud
>>

>> ONElist: the best source for group communications.

>Message: 6
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 17:49:04 -0500
> From: "Shadow Panther" <shdwpanther@...>
>Subject: Re: PET COMMANDS
>
>
> They're in the everquest_manual.txt file in your \everquest\ directory.
>
> /pet
> sit down
> stand up
> attack
> back off
> guard me
> guard here
> as you where <- I've never noticed that do anything.
>
> be _sure_ you /pet follow me after you tell it to sit, as it will not
get up and follow you unless you do. Thus, you could lose your pet,
especially in a big zone.
>
>~Mysk
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Mata
> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
> Sent: Thursday, May 13, 1999 10:47 AM
> Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] PET COMMANDS

> Does anyone know a good web site or where I can find a list of the
commands for your Skeleton??? and how do you make them use a weapon? Just

>Message: 7
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 17:54:41 -0500
> From: "Shadow Panther" <shdwpanther@...>
>Subject: Re: VAMPIRIC EMBRACE
>
>
> Yeah the spell has a duration, a very short duration. You're not
likely
>to get very many life-taps out of it, unless you have something like a
>dagger with a very fast attack rate. But even then, you have to go hand to
>hand, and we're casters. I don't personally find a great use for it,
>although other Necros have.
>
>~Mysk
>
>> From: "Mata" <mata_eq@...>
>>
>> Sweet! So the spell has a duration and you cast it and them melee??? and
>it
>> can happen more than once?? That is great!
>
>
>

>∩┐╜H∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜: Kent Anderson <wart1@...>
>∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
>∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜∩┐╜: 1999∩┐╜~5∩┐╜∩┐╜17∩┐╜∩┐╜ AM 05:11
>∩┐╜D∩┐╜∩┐╜: [EQ_Necromancer] Re Gnomes in Neriak(or other non DE)
>
>
>>From: Kent Anderson <wart1@...>
>>
>>As I understand it all necros regardless of race can visit the guild in
>>Neriak. Thats the GUILD, however, guards may still KOS ceretain races
>>so conn them. The guild is guarded by Ghouls who will KOS most non DE
>>who try and enter there, as well as the wandering pets who may take
>>exception to other races. Use invis to enter, conn guards from a
>>distance, if they aren't immdiately hostile cast invis to undead once
>>you enter the third gate of neriak and you should be able to get past
>>the Ghouls. Just remember to recast it after you visit the guild when
>>trying to go past the ghouls again. THe secret here is to conn
>>everything before getting within attack range. Also, if you've been
>>killing Crushbone Orc don't even go into Nektulous forest, the Indigo
>>Brotherhood is the Dark Elves so your faction is probably in the KOS
>>range.
>>
>>Slortar on Karana
>>
>>

>Message: 11
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 17:34:18 -0700
> From: "W.G. Rowland" <wgr@...>
>Subject: Fw: Pet class suggestion..
>
>I posted a message to EQ Necros and Mages about adding a spell that gave
the
>level of the pet being summoned.. It was pointed out that Verant wasn't
>likely to do anything that would show numerical information.. Still
unhappy
>with the fact that one could exactly gage a pets ability (by /conning) at
>the level one gains the new pet spell, but knows less about it as they go
up
>I came up with the idea of having a message pop up when summoning a new pet
>that basically does a /con of the pet in regards to the level of the spell
>not the level of the caster (So irregardless of level you know if your pet
>is good average or weak for it's level..)
>
>Today I got a reply.. Hoping maybe it'll be implemented in the future..
>
>WGR
>----- Original Message -----
>From: <gzatkin@...>
>To: W.G. Rowland <wgr@...>
>Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 5:12 PM
>Subject: Re: Pet class suggestion..
>
>
>>
>>
>> > As it stands now, when a new pet spell is gained, you summon the
pet,
>> /con it, and have a pretty good gage of it's ability.. (Level above,
level
>> below, or equal to the level of the spell).. But as you go up in level
>your
>> ability to gage the creature (which you've had time to use, and
logically,
>> should have a better ability to gage) gets worse. This gets even worse
>> until you hit the next spell level..
>> >
>> > A simple message that says at the time of casting - You summon a
>> weak/average/strong pet of it's kind. Would solve this, and I don't
think
>> would be horrific to code (just adding a text message as opposed to new
>> spells or new game logic..)
>> >
>> > Anyway.. That's my wish.. And if there is a logic reason for the
>> current situation, could you explain it to me? I understand the need for
>> randomness (I actually like that as opposed to always having an average
>> pet).. But I don't understand why the summoner, who should know his pet
>> better than any, has to find a lower level character and ask, "How strong
>is
>> this pet?"
>>
>> Hmmm - I'll bounce this one around the dev team... thanks for
the
>> suggestion. :)
>>
>> Geoffrey C. Zatkin
>> Arch-Magi of Norrath
>>
>___________________________________________________________________________
>>
>> Verant Interactive gzatkin@...
>www.everquest.com
>>
>>
>
>
>
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>
>Message: 12
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 23:20:08 -0400
> From: "James" <manickd@...>
>Subject: Re: S. Ro
>
>THere is no better place to get to level 12. I am almost at level 12. I got
>bound to grobb at level 4. In so ro there is some orks camps that have
>centuries far from the group so you can kill then easy and get good ex.
They
>are the camps just befor the desert. on the east side!!! Also when you get
>to level 11. Your pet sucks again. Well troll warriors make wonderfull
pets.
>Just dont tell them that s what they are. Get impart strenth and dark
>empathy and group up at level 9, 10, 11 and kill dervish for good money.
>They have bronxe weapons and that worth good plat. Also in guk the froggie
>city there is lots of woven armor to be had off the froggies!! So good luck
>dark brother!
>
